CatDescriptText: Harold Watkins, postal worker, Philadelphia and H.L. Jacobson, postal worker, Philadelphia, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 19, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of teachers paddling children?"  Mr. Watkins' answer reads: "No. Nobody is to paddle my children except my wife and I."  Mr. Jacobson's answer reads: "No, I don't.  A teacher should never use physical punishment.  He or she should deny privileges or keep them after school."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Harold Watkins wearing dark fedora and plaid coat with upturned collar, standing in front of lighting store; Portrait of H.L. Jacobson wearing fedora and patterned tie, standing in front of lighting store
